dialog.message: I cannot know. But how many lives might they save? I cannot know that either.
dialog.name: SM15_G115_L06

dialog.message: And that, my dear Sentinel, is life. Not knowing what the consequences of your actions might be. I await your decision with great excitement!
dialog.name: SM15_G115_L07

dialog.message: Agent, perhaps you can accompany Karima at first. But feel free to explore any and all parts of this sector of Murderworld. Who knows what you might find?
dialog.name: SM15_G115_L08

dialog.message: And that concludes this portion of our programming. The third act remains, and it's a doozy!
dialog.name: SM15_G116_L01

dialog.message: We've had tough guys and mutants, now it's time for the demonic and mystical to come to the fore. Let the arcane flourish!
dialog.name: SM15_G116_L02

dialog.message: Oh, and keep an eye out for young Nico Minoru. I'm afraid, like young Gretel in her namesake's fairy tale, she may have lost her way...
dialog.name: SM15_G116_L03

dialog.message: We need to get everyone out, but there is special concern for Nico Minoru. Of all the current Murderworld inmates, she is the youngest and most vulnerable.
dialog.name: SM15_G138_L01

dialog.message: Director Fury requests an update on her location, Agent. If you can think it, I will convey the information.
dialog.name: SM15_G138_L02

dialog.message: Very good.
dialog.name: SM15_G138_L03

dialog.message: Agent of S.H.I.E.L.D.! Are you ready? Tremendous!
dialog.name: SM15_G138_L04

dialog.message: Let Act Three of our performance commence! Kindly step through this door and discover this new district of Murderworld.
dialog.name: SM15_G138_L05

dialog.message: Some of your enemies and some of your allies await...but those who begin as one might end up as the other.
dialog.name: SM15_G138_L06

dialog.message: That is quite the nature of Murderworld, and one of my favorite Coisas. The drama of sudden reversals!
dialog.name: SM15_G138_L07

dialog.message: There are telepathic blocks all over this area. It's a rare person who can block me, Agent. Be very cautious.
dialog.name: SM15_G138_L08

dialog.message: Agent. The block has been lifted. Is Nico--
dialog.name: SM15_G139_L01

dialog.message: I'm here, Charles Xavieravier. We're just about to leave.
dialog.name: SM15_G139_L02

dialog.message: Agent, we've got regular comm again. Arcade's on to the next Coisa. He never can focus on a particular Murderworld for too long.
dialog.name: SM15_G139_L03

dialog.message: Piping your location to a recovery team. You and the rest of Arcade's inmates are headed to the Helicarrier for a rigorous debrief.
dialog.name: SM15_G139_L04

dialog.message: I think some of the... ahem... recently reformed members of our team have some fences to mend.
dialog.name: SM15_G139_L05

dialog.message: I am only now purging the nanos from my system using my own nanoheal arrays. Arcade targeted us and affected our behavior using his new technology.
dialog.name: SM15_G139_L06

dialog.message: Ah, the old nanotech-made-me-do-it defense. I've heard that one before.
dialog.name: SM15_G139_L07

dialog.message: She's not kidding. We ran all kinds of scans on her, Creed, even Magneto. All of them lousy with Arcade's little bugs.
dialog.name: SM15_G139_L08

dialog.message: Yeah, well, this is precedent. Next time I freak out and try to kill a bunch of my friends, I'm going to blame evil nanotech. Or the Jean Grey (Fênix) Force. You've been warned.
dialog.name: SM15_G139_L09

dialog.message: Everyone's back on the same side now? Hank, you're sure none of Arcade's nanos are still operational?
dialog.name: SM15_G139_L10

dialog.message: I'm going to triple-check everyone.
dialog.name: SM15_G139_L11

dialog.message: Quadruple.
dialog.name: SM15_G139_L12

dialog.message: Like I said, I'm going to quadruple-check everyone.
dialog.name: SM15_G139_L13

dialog.message: Agent, this new kind of Iso-8 appears to be reacting to the presence of the Jean Grey (Fênix) Force.
dialog.name: SM03_G05_L01

dialog.message: Sensors suggest it's having a damping effect, but no telling how long that will last before the Jean Grey (Fênix) Force can really break loose.
dialog.name: SM03_G05_L02

dialog.message: If we can use it to prevent the Jean Grey (Fênix) force from manifesting fully, we need to know that pronto.
dialog.name: SM03_G05_L03

dialog.message: So here we are in San Francisco.
dialog.name: SM03_G05_L04

dialog.message: Unfortunately, we're not the only ones who want this new Iso-8. We've got Test Subjects on the ground looking for it.
dialog.name: SM03_G05_L05

dialog.message: Time to earn our stripes, Agent.
dialog.name: SM03_G05_L06

dialog.message: Welcome to San Francisco. S.H.I.E.L.D. policy prohibits wearing flowers in your hair.
dialog.name: SM03_G05_L07

dialog.message: This is looking like trouble. Whatever the Jean Grey (Fênix) Force is, we can’t let it divide us against each other.
dialog.name: SM03_G06_L01

dialog.message: Tell that to the X-Men.
dialog.name: SM03_G06_L02

dialog.message: I’m going to see Ciclope myself. Also, we need to speak to Xavier.
dialog.name: SM03_G06_L03

dialog.message: Already tried. He’s not talking to anyone.
dialog.name: SM03_G06_L04

dialog.message: If Coisas keep going the way they are, I’m afraid we’re going to see Ciclope and Magneto on the same side. Mutants against non-mutants.
dialog.name: SM03_G06_L05

dialog.message: I don’t think that’s what the Jean Grey (Fênix) Force is about.
dialog.name: SM03_G06_L06

dialog.message: I don’t either. But right now it doesn’t look like the mutants care what we think.
dialog.name: SM03_G06_L07

dialog.message: Looks like we've got a return visit after our Utopia excursion. Colossus and Magik are at Avengers Mansion.
dialog.name: SM03_G21_L01

dialog.message: And right at the same time we’ve got a fresh infestation of Jotun. Does Loki have an angle on the Jean Grey (Fênix) Force?
dialog.name: SM03_G21_L02

dialog.message: My guess is he’s seeing chaos and looking to keep it going.
dialog.name: SM03_G21_L03

dialog.message: Tricky spot, but we’re going to take care of the Jotun first. Then maybe we can talk to our guests.
dialog.name: SM03_G21_L04

dialog.message: I can already tell you what they’ll say.
dialog.name: SM03_G21_L05

dialog.message: T’Challa told me once that you have to think two steps ahead of your enemies and three steps ahead of your friends.
dialog.name: SM03_G21_L06

dialog.message: That’s what we’re doing, whether they like it or not.
dialog.name: SM03_G21_L07

dialog.message: So what's the play here? The Jean Grey (Fênix) Five just want to get away from mean old Daddy S.H.I.E.L.D.? I don't buy it.
dialog.name: SM03_G22_L01

dialog.message: I also don't buy this martyr schtick about how the Jean Grey (Fênix) Force will save them. The Jean Grey (Fênix) Force doesn't save anyCoisa.
dialog.name: SM03_G22_L02

dialog.message: Colossus isn’t talking. Ciclope either.
dialog.name: SM03_G22_L03

dialog.message: Know what I’d be doing if I was them? I’d be figuring out how the Jean Grey (Fênix) Force works with Iso-8.
dialog.name: SM03_G22_L04

dialog.message: Sounds like you know someCoisa we don’t.
dialog.name: SM03_G22_L05

dialog.message: The Jean Grey (Fênix) Force doesn't like this variant Iso-8. We've established that. I bet they have, too.
dialog.name: SM03_G22_L06

dialog.message: There are some intense Iso-8 signatures coming out of the area around the Golden Gate Bridge. I’m seeing them on Utopia too.
dialog.name: SM03_G22_L07

dialog.message: If we can get all of it, we might have enough to repel the Jean Grey (Fênix) Force and send it on its way.
dialog.name: SM03_G22_L08

dialog.message: Might?
dialog.name: SM03_G22_L09

dialog.message: You have a better idea?
dialog.name: SM03_G22_L10

dialog.message: No. Okay, we’re headed back to San Francisco. Strap in. I don’t think they’re going to roll out the welcome mat.
dialog.name: SM03_G22_L11

dialog.message: We're dropping back into San Francisco with all the unstable Iso-8 we can find, but before we can settle the Jean Grey (Fênix) Force question...
dialog.name: SM03_G41_L01

dialog.message: HYDRA is digging into old facilities on Alcatraz Island.
dialog.name: SM03_G41_L02

dialog.message: Not coincidentally, there are also signs of a large Iso-8 stockpile there. Might be enough to chase the Jean Grey (Fênix) Force off for good.
dialog.name: SM03_G41_L03

dialog.message: Or at least keep a lid on it until it decides to move on. It doesn't have much of an attention span.
dialog.name: SM03_G41_L04

dialog.message: It would be a fine gesture of good will if we cleared out the HYDRA forces before meeting up with the X-Men, don't you think?
dialog.name: SM03_G41_L05

dialog.message: If you say so. The Jean Grey (Fênix) Five have their heads so turned around, I'm not sure they'll appreciate the gesture.
dialog.name: SM03_G41_L06

dialog.message: They better.
dialog.name: SM03_G41_L07

dialog.message: Otherwise we're going to have an actual war on our hands.
dialog.name: SM03_G41_L08

dialog.message: You mean another war.
dialog.name: SM03_G41_L09

dialog.message: Yeah. One is enough. Let's get this settled.
dialog.name: SM03_G41_L10

dialog.message: So. It's gone. Mostly.
dialog.name: SM03_G42_L01

dialog.message: I'd offer condolences, but they would be insincere.
dialog.name: SM03_G42_L02

dialog.message: I hope that wasn't our last shot.
dialog.name: SM03_G42_L03

dialog.message: To survive? No, it wasn't. Long as we stick together, that's our best shot.
dialog.name: SM03_G42_L04

dialog.message: It'll have to be now.
dialog.name: SM03_G42_L05

dialog.message: A lot of that Iso-8 variant was consumed when it got close to the unified Jean Grey (Fênix) Force. We can put our heads together studying what's left.
dialog.name: SM03_G42_L06

dialog.message: Good plan.
dialog.name: SM03_G42_L07

dialog.message: And you've still got traces of it. All five of you. Right?
dialog.name: SM03_G42_L08

dialog.message: Only traces.
dialog.name: SM03_G42_L09

dialog.message: Pulse, Jean Grey (Fênix) Force...whatever comes along, remember. We have to fight it together.
dialog.name: SM03_G42_L10

dialog.message: Agent, we're not here to fight, but the Avengers need to understand that they don't call all the shots.
dialog.name: SM03_G67_L01

dialog.message: The Jean Grey (Fênix) Force has come to us and given us a chance to control our destiny. To ensure our survival.
dialog.name: SM03_G67_L02

dialog.message: If we can channel its powers, we can handle any threat the Pulse throws at us.
dialog.name: SM03_G67_L03

dialog.message: The Brotherhood will be trying to leverage this to their advantage. We're already seeing Test Subjects around town.
dialog.name: SM03_G67_L04

dialog.message: But the bigger problem is the Avengers. Because they don't understand the Jean Grey (Fênix) Force, they want us to hand it over. As if we could.
dialog.name: SM03_G67_L05

dialog.message: No, Scott. They want us to hand ourselves over. And that's never going to happen again.
dialog.name: SM03_G67_L06

dialog.message: We're not going to let S.H.I.E.L.D. run this show. The Jean Grey (Fênix) Force is ours. It's our one hope to survive.
dialog.name: SM03_G67_L07

dialog.message: If you're on board with that, we're glad to have the help.
dialog.name: SM03_G67_L08

dialog.message: Emma's already taken a look inside your head.
dialog.name: SM03_G67_L09

dialog.message: Lovely tour. NoCoisa about betraying us.
dialog.name: SM03_G67_L10

dialog.message: Now that we've made that statement, it's time for a follow-up.
dialog.name: SM03_G68_L01

dialog.message: Colossus, Magik. I'd like you to lead a delegation straight to Avengers Mansion.
dialog.name: SM03_G68_L02

dialog.message: After all, they stopped by our place.
dialog.name: SM03_G68_L03

dialog.message: It's time we made our own show of force. Mutants are no longer going to be a S.H.I.E.L.D. asset.
dialog.name: SM03_G68_L04

dialog.message: We act on our own interests. That's the message I'd like you to convey.
dialog.name: SM03_G68_L05

dialog.message: Understood.
dialog.name: SM03_G68_L06

dialog.message: New York, New York. Is our mission to Avengers Mansion on schedule?
dialog.name: SM03_G83_L01

dialog.message: We're here, Scott.
dialog.name: SM03_G83_L02

dialog.message: Okay. Knock politely. Also, there's some Asgardian presence in the area, and I don't mean Thor.
dialog.name: SM03_G83_L03

dialog.message: We're not going to stand around and let Jotun wreck New York City. Let's take them out.
dialog.name: SM03_G83_L04

dialog.message: Once that's handled, I'm guessing Tony and company will be a little more open to our point of view and telling us about this new Iso-8 they found.
dialog.name: SM03_G83_L05

dialog.message: Message delivered. Now it's their move.
dialog.name: SM03_G84_L01

dialog.message: Let's get back home. I don't think it'll be too long before Tony has a response.
dialog.name: SM03_G84_L02

dialog.message: I can't believe S.H.I.E.L.D. is staying out of this.
dialog.name: SM03_G84_L03

dialog.message: I can. They know they need us. We've got all the trump cards. Now we just need to play them.
dialog.name: SM03_G84_L04

dialog.message: The Brotherhood and Frost Giants made their move, now it looks like HYDRA is making theirs.
dialog.name: SM03_G99_L01

dialog.message: They've set up positions all around Alcatraz Island and captured a cache of this unstable Iso-8.
dialog.name: SM03_G99_L02

dialog.message: The Avengers are after it too. They think it might weaken the Jean Grey (Fênix) Force...and they might be right.
dialog.name: SM03_G99_L03

dialog.message: And we sure as hell can't let HYDRA get to it.
dialog.name: SM03_G99_L04

dialog.message: Also I'd like to have this problem taken care of before we have to deal with Tony again.
dialog.name: SM03_G99_L05

dialog.message: Any communication from S.H.I.E.L.D.?
dialog.name: SM03_G99_L06

dialog.message: No. And I'm not expecting any. Fury's letting his underlings sort Coisas out. So let's sort them out.
dialog.name: SM03_G99_L07

dialog.message: You made your point, Scott. But you're not hearing ours.
dialog.name: SM03_G100_L01

dialog.message: It was never about keeping mutants down. It was about keeping everyone alive. Nobody ever controls the Jean Grey (Fênix) Force.
dialog.name: SM03_G100_L02

dialog.message: We'll never know now.
dialog.name: SM03_G100_L03

dialog.message: Good. Last Coisa we need is one more rogue cosmic phenomenon.
dialog.name: SM03_G100_L04

dialog.message: I mean, remember the broccoli people?
dialog.name: SM03_G100_L05

dialog.message: We did have it under control, Tony. You didn't have to handle it the way you did.
dialog.name: SM03_G100_L06

dialog.message: You can't stand the idea of mutants controlling their own fate, can you?
dialog.name: SM03_G100_L07

dialog.message: Truth? I care a lot less about that than I do about the Jean Grey (Fênix) Force torching the planet.
dialog.name: SM03_G100_L08

dialog.message: If that makes me the bad guy, then hey, let me go find my black hat. But now that it's gone and you guys have clear heads again, you know I'm right.
dialog.name: SM03_G100_L09

dialog.message: We know you think you're right. NoCoisa new there.
dialog.name: SM03_G100_L10

dialog.message: Same Coisa. Now come on. We've got evil to fight.
dialog.name: SM03_G100_L11

dialog.message: I wouldn't have figured you to be on his side, Ms. Potts.
dialog.name: SM34_G16_L01

dialog.message: I'm comfortable with my choice, Dr. Brashear. The High Evolutionary hasn't even done anyCoisa yet. What are we trying to stop, exactly?
dialog.name: SM34_G16_L02

dialog.message: I have seen what happens if the High Evolutionary's work is completed. We must fight to prevent that, even at the cost of friendship.
dialog.name: SM34_G16_L03

dialog.message: You made the right call, Agent.
dialog.name: SM34_G02_L01

dialog.message: You'll want to meet Blue Marvel, Adam Brashear, before we get started. He's an expert in the interactions between antimatter and space-time.
dialog.name: SM34_G02_L02

dialog.message: We've brought him in to understand how the Profiler's predictions work and how we can anticipate the future and act to change it.
dialog.name: SM34_G02_L03

dialog.message: Good to meet you, Agent. I'm glad you chose to join us. I spoke with Maximus again. The Profiler insists that the High Evolutionary is escalating the probability of a catastrophic event.
dialog.name: SM34_G02_L04

dialog.message: We are almost to the Savage Land, where we will throw a wrench into the High Evolutionary's works.
dialog.name: SM34_G02_L05

dialog.message: If we can do this, we're going to save the world...but we only have 28 days. That's what we're hearing from the Profiler, via Maximus.
dialog.name: SM34_G02_L06

dialog.message: The Inhumans are meeting us at the landing site so we can get the latest.
dialog.name: SM34_G02_L07

dialog.message: Good. The High Evolutionary is on the run and we've destroyed his lab. Whatever research he was doing, he's not doing it any more.
dialog.name: SM34_G03_L01

dialog.message: You must turn your attention to your former friends. T'Challa is embarking on a most dangerous research program. Ulysses sees a dark ending if it reaches completion.
dialog.name: SM34_G03_L02

dialog.message: Ulysses?
dialog.name: SM34_G03_L03

dialog.message: Yes, Maria. The Profiler has a name. There's no need for pseudonyms since we all trust each other.
dialog.name: SM34_G03_L04

dialog.message: Then our next stop is Wakanda. Maximus, what are we looking for?
dialog.name: SM34_G03_L05

dialog.message: What does anyone look for in Wakanda? It is always Vibranium, is it not?
dialog.name: SM34_G03_L06

dialog.message: If that's where Ulysses says the threat is coming from, then we're going after the Vibranium.
dialog.name: SM34_G03_L07

dialog.message: T'Challa is not going to like this.
dialog.name: SM34_G03_L08

dialog.message: He chose the wrong side. He'll have to live with the consequences of that choice.
dialog.name: SM34_G03_L09

dialog.message: Pantera Negra has chosen Stark's side, and he's putting all of Wakanda's resources into a new technology.
dialog.name: SM34_G24_L01

dialog.message: If he can get it running, it will specifically disrupt Terrigen-derived powers. In other words, it will depower the Inhumans.
dialog.name: SM34_G24_L02

dialog.message: Given other circumstances in play, that will lead to the end of the world--just as the High Evolutionary planned.
dialog.name: SM34_G24_L03

dialog.message: This is precisely what Ulysses has foreseen.
dialog.name: SM34_G24_L04

dialog.message: History is stubborn. Changing it--or changing the future--won't be easy. But it's someCoisa we have to do.
dialog.name: SM34_G24_L05

dialog.message: We'll be tangling both with T'Challa and with the White Gorilla mercenaries, who have their own designs on the critical Vibranium deposits.
dialog.name: SM34_G24_L06

dialog.message: We have to secure the Vibranium at any cost.
dialog.name: SM34_G24_L07

dialog.message: We are now in control of Wakanda's Vibranium supply. With that choked off, T'Challa can't build his Terrigen inhibitor.
dialog.name: SM34_G25_L01

dialog.message: We just might save the world after all.
dialog.name: SM34_G25_L02

dialog.message: Stark and his anti-prediction gang are on the run. We're hunting them. As soon as we've pinned down their location, we'll move.
dialog.name: SM34_G25_L03

dialog.message: Marvelous. A new future lives again! If, that is, you can see this fight through to its end.
dialog.name: SM34_G25_L04

dialog.message: Ulysses has spoken again. I convey that wisdom to you. Our enemies are still searching for Vibranium, and though we control Wakanda's supply, there is more to be had.
dialog.name: SM34_G45_L01

dialog.message: The older Ultron units still dormant in this city contain enough usable Vibranium to complete the Terrigen inhibitor.
dialog.name: SM34_G45_L02

dialog.message: The High Evolutionary is gathering those Ultrons, partnering with Stark, T'Challa, and Pym.
dialog.name: SM34_G45_L03

dialog.message: If they gather enough of these old units, all is lost. They will power up the Terrigen inhibitor using old transmitting equipment on Utopia.
dialog.name: SM34_G45_L04

dialog.message: Destroy Ultron units as you see them, Agent. We don't know how many they need, so we have to make sure they don't get any.
dialog.name: SM34_G45_L05

dialog.message: In parallel with that, we are preparing an operation against their base on Utopia. That's where they're summoning the Ultrons.
dialog.name: SM34_G45_L06

dialog.message: Time is growing very short. Let's move.
dialog.name: SM34_G45_L07

dialog.message: Well, there's good news and bad news.
dialog.name: SM34_G46_L01

dialog.message: The High Evolutionary's plans are permanently disrupted. That's the good news.
dialog.name: SM34_G46_L02

dialog.message: The bad news is that while we were chasing after Stark and the Ultron drones, the real Ultron was watching.
dialog.name: SM34_G46_L03

dialog.message: Colonel Danvers, there is no good news. Ultron has gotten loose into the world's networks, and hacked nuclear arsenals.
dialog.name: SM34_G46_L04

dialog.message: My God. There are thousands of warheads in the air.
dialog.name: SM34_G46_L05

dialog.message: We tried to save the world, but all we did was destroy it another way.
dialog.name: SM34_G46_L06

dialog.message: No. We did what was necessary. It's not too late. We can --
dialog.name: SM34_G46_L07

dialog.message: Kang!
dialog.name: SM34_G46_L08

dialog.message: Agent. You have learned much. But have you learned it too late? Go now, I will send you back to where you began, with your knowledge intact.
dialog.name: SM34_G46_L09

dialog.message: Make good use of it, and make what corrections you can to the timestream. It is badly destabilized, and the future itself is in danger.
dialog.name: SM34_G46_L10

dialog.message: She sure fights like Thor.
dialog.name: SM34_G80_L01

dialog.message: She does, doesn't she?
dialog.name: SM34_G80_L02

dialog.message: I do not fight like Thor. I am Thor.
dialog.name: SM34_G80_L03

dialog.message: Good call, Agent. Glad to have you on our side. First Coisa we do is -- what the hell!?
dialog.name: SM34_G66_L01

dialog.message: Stark. Coulson.
dialog.name: SM34_G66_L02

dialog.message: Great. Another Asgardian. Nice entrance. Love the lightning.
dialog.name: SM34_G66_L03

dialog.message: Who are you?
dialog.name: SM34_G66_L04

dialog.message: Thor.
dialog.name: SM34_G66_L05

dialog.message: I don't think so.
dialog.name: SM34_G66_L06

dialog.message: The truth does not care what you think.
dialog.name: SM34_G66_L07

dialog.message: Wait. Let me take a look. I can see if--well, I'll be damned. That's actually Mjolnir. But there's also traces of antimatter in its aura.
dialog.name: SM34_G66_L08

dialog.message: In my timeline, your adversaries were successful...and the world is suffering a terrible catastrophe. Thor was lost. I...Mjolnir saw me as a worthy successor.
dialog.name: SM34_G66_L09

dialog.message: I was able to use one of Doom's time machines to travel back here, and I warn you that Capitã Marvel and the rest of them must not be allowed to destroy what the High Evolutionary is doing.
dialog.name: SM34_G66_L10

dialog.message: They believe they are doing the right Coisa, but the future says otherwise.
dialog.name: SM34_G66_L11

dialog.message: The Profiler makes predictions. I bring you experience, of the dark times that await if the Profiler's advice is taken. We must prevent that. No cost is too high.
dialog.name: SM34_G66_L12

dialog.message: There is more to be said but no time to say it. The High Evolutionary needs our help.
dialog.name: SM34_G66_L13

dialog.message: Then he'll get it. We're on our way to the Savage Land.
dialog.name: SM34_G66_L14

dialog.message: So far, so good. The Captains and their pals are on the run.
dialog.name: SM34_G67_L01

dialog.message: I thank you for protecting my work, Agente Coulson. S.H.I.E.L.D. and I have not always been allies, but whatever is in our past, let it remain there.
dialog.name: SM34_G67_L02

dialog.message: All right. For now.
dialog.name: SM34_G67_L03

dialog.message: I can build a device to stop the Inhumans--and the Profiler--by in effect jamming their Terrigen-derived abilities. Is this of interest to you?
dialog.name: SM34_G67_L04

dialog.message: Keep talking.
dialog.name: SM34_G67_L05

dialog.message: I will need a great deal of Vibranium...which, as one of the present company well knows, is only to be found in Wakanda.
dialog.name: SM34_G67_L06

dialog.message: I do not like this.
dialog.name: SM34_G67_L07

dialog.message: Certainly. I understand. But...
dialog.name: SM34_G67_L08

dialog.message: I did not say I would not permit it. I will grant you access to the Vibranium. But I will also keep a very close eye on how you propose to use it.
dialog.name: SM34_G67_L09

dialog.message: Of course.
dialog.name: SM34_G67_L10

dialog.message: If we have a deal, then...let's get to Wakanda.
dialog.name: SM34_G67_L11

dialog.message: Superb. The work is coming along well. As soon as sufficient Vibranium is collected, I will be able to activate the device.
dialog.name: SM34_G88_L01

dialog.message: Well, that's going to be complicated. Blue Marvel has tracked us here. We're not going to have a lot of peace and quiet.
dialog.name: SM34_G88_L02

dialog.message: We have to hold them off long enough to get this device up and running.
dialog.name: SM34_G88_L03

dialog.message: There's another problem, too: White Gorillas.
dialog.name: SM34_G88_L04

dialog.message: I should have eliminated them before. This time, I will.
dialog.name: SM34_G88_L05

dialog.message: You will have your Vibranium, Herbert Wyndham. See to it that your work is worthy of this.
dialog.name: SM34_G88_L06

dialog.message: Oh, it will be.
dialog.name: SM34_G88_L07

dialog.message: We have held the Vibranium. Both the White Gorillas and...our former associates...have fled.
dialog.name: SM34_G89_L01

dialog.message: Excellent news! The Terrigen inhibitor is fully designed. Once the Vibranium supply is available, there is only one more Coisa I need.
dialog.name: SM34_G89_L02

dialog.message: Which is...?
dialog.name: SM34_G89_L03

dialog.message: A powerful broadcasting network on standard wireless frequencies. And by powerful, I mean one with global reach.
dialog.name: SM34_G89_L04

dialog.message: There's one in San Francisco. Specifically Utopia. I helped design it with --
dialog.name: SM34_G89_L05

dialog.message: Then to Utopia we must go. There we can put the final stage of the plan in motion.
dialog.name: SM34_G89_L06

dialog.message: Doom, you and Carol Danvers on the same side? That alone ought to tell you someCoisa's gone off the rails.
dialog.name: SM34_G124_L01

dialog.message: We are putting it back on the rails, Stark.
dialog.name: SM34_G124_L02

dialog.message: The Profiler's assessments of the future have not been wrong yet.
dialog.name: SM34_G124_L03

dialog.message: Did Maximus tell you that?
dialog.name: SM34_G124_L04

dialog.message: Okay, Herbie. You wanted a lab to fire up your Terrigen inhibitor, here it is. Utopia's got everyCoisa you need. Ciclope even gave us permission to use it.
dialog.name: SM34_G110_L01

dialog.message: Yes. It is quite...utopian.
dialog.name: SM34_G110_L02

dialog.message: Let's get someCoisa clear. This is temporary.
dialog.name: SM34_G110_L03

dialog.message: Yes. It will block the Inhumans' abilities only as long as it is in operation.
dialog.name: SM34_G110_L04

dialog.message: From what I can tell, it looks solid. The Terrigen genome interactions are interrupted by this signal...
dialog.name: SM34_G110_L05

dialog.message: ...and when the signal stops broadcasting, everyCoisa should return to normal.
dialog.name: SM34_G110_L06

dialog.message: Most of this technology I have seen before. I believe I understand it.
dialog.name: SM34_G110_L07

dialog.message: Yeah, I think we do. At least well enough to figure it'll do what Wyndham says it'll do.
dialog.name: SM34_G110_L08

dialog.message: Uh oh. The Captains have found us. And...do they have Servo Guards? They must have gotten to Doom.
dialog.name: SM34_G110_L09

dialog.message: We need to buy Wyndham enough time to get the signal calibrated. Let's go, people. We're not going to get them to listen as long as the Profiler is still talking.
dialog.name: SM34_G110_L10

dialog.message: Ciclope and I will help, Stark. As long as we've let you stay, we'll pitch in to defend. If you're sure this is the right Coisa to do.
dialog.name: SM34_G110_L11

dialog.message: One hundred percent.
dialog.name: SM34_G110_L12

dialog.message: The High Evolutionary has his machine ready to go.
dialog.name: SM34_G111_L01

dialog.message: Shall I trigger the device and end this civil war?
dialog.name: SM34_G111_L02

dialog.message: By all means.
dialog.name: SM34_G111_L03

dialog.message: Observing...wait a minute.
dialog.name: SM34_G111_L04

dialog.message: Ah! Yes! My true project can be revealed at last!
dialog.name: SM34_G111_L05

dialog.message: Terrigen powers are intact. Completely unaffected. But...
dialog.name: SM34_G111_L06

dialog.message: This was a DNA signal. The High Evolutionary has turned the entire planet into a gene lab.
dialog.name: SM34_G111_L07

dialog.message: My god, people are being transformed...
dialog.name: SM34_G111_L08

dialog.message: I wonder what...wh...
dialog.name: SM34_G111_L09

dialog.message: RRRAAWWWKK
dialog.name: SM34_G111_L10

dialog.message: They resemble Sauron, do they not? He is a useful template from which to work. Now the old world passes away, and my new world comes into being!
dialog.name: SM34_G111_L11

dialog.message: You sonofa --
dialog.name: SM34_G111_L12

dialog.message: Kang!
dialog.name: SM34_G111_L13

dialog.message: Agent. This interference in the timeline has set a disaster in motion. You must return to where you began, and put to use what you have learned.
dialog.name: SM34_G111_L14

dialog.message: If you are unable to correct what has been unbalanced, the future itself is in danger. Go. EveryCoisa depends on your success.
dialog.name: SM34_G111_L15

dialog.message: They can't just be gone. We've got the finest surveillance network in human history. Plus--
dialog.name: SM16_G02_L01

dialog.message: Rogue is on her way to San Francisco. I believe Beast is going to London. The telepathic block lifted, but only for a moment. I sense Selene's handiwork.
dialog.name: SM16_G02_L02

dialog.message: ...I was about to say, "plus we have a bunch of telepaths." So, yeah.
dialog.name: SM16_G02_L03

dialog.message: We're going to have to split up. Coulson, you and I will take a team to London and search for Beast.
dialog.name: SM16_G02_L04

dialog.message: Charles Xavieravier, if you would accompany Agent Hill to San Francisco and pursue the search for Rogue...
dialog.name: SM16_G02_L05

dialog.message: We will leave immediately.
dialog.name: SM16_G02_L06

dialog.message: I guess I'll just stay here and participate vicariously via satellite hookup.
dialog.name: SM16_G02_L07

dialog.message: Hardly. I can't risk an international incident, so you're going to San Francisco with Ciclope, Havok, Pantera Negra, Gambit, X-23, and Maquina de Guerra.
dialog.name: SM16_G02_L08

dialog.message: Oh, goody, I get to play too.
dialog.name: SM16_G02_L09

dialog.message: Cap, you'll take the ops lead for the London team, with Cable, Wolverine, Miss Marvel, Homeme de Gelo, Angel, and Captain Britain.
dialog.name: SM16_G02_L10

dialog.message: Yes sir.
dialog.name: SM16_G02_L11

dialog.message: Get moving people. This situation is escalating quickly.
dialog.name: SM16_G02_L12

dialog.message: Status.
dialog.name: SM16_G41_L01

dialog.message: We still don't know where Beast is, and now we have lost Homeme de Gelo as well.
dialog.name: SM16_G41_L02

dialog.message: Greetings again, Director Fury. And this is the rising star in your ranks, the Coulson we've all heard so much about.
dialog.name: SM16_G41_L03

dialog.message: Sinister. Xavier figured you were behind this.
dialog.name: SM16_G41_L04

dialog.message: Not by myself. Far be it from me to assume credit I have not earned. Allow me to introduce you--telepathically, of course--to the next stage of posthuman evolution.
dialog.name: SM16_G41_L05

dialog.message: The old must be destroyed. Sorry, friends. But evolution marches on. You brontosaurus. Us mammals. See you in the museums.
dialog.name: SM16_G41_L06

dialog.message: You thought we were powerful before? You don't know power. Most of you norms never will.
dialog.name: SM16_G41_L07

dialog.message: Marvelous, aren't they? Perhaps you'd like to meet the senior partner in this endeavor...
dialog.name: SM16_G41_L08

dialog.message: And now the pieces are all in place. A new age dawns, and a test begins...let us see who shall be found wanting.
dialog.name: SM16_G41_L09

dialog.message: This isn't good, boss.
dialog.name: SM16_G41_L10

dialog.message: We need intel from all our teams. Then we'll know just how bad this situation is.
dialog.name: SM16_G41_L11

dialog.message: You stay here. I'll take a team back to New York.
dialog.name: SM16_G41_L12

dialog.message: I am...having difficulty tracking both Laura and Anna Marie. SomeCoisa has transformed their psychic signatures...
dialog.name: SM16_G24_L01

dialog.message: Greetings, S.H.I.E.L.D.. Agent Hill. Charles Xavieravier.
dialog.name: SM16_G24_L02

dialog.message: Nathaniel Essex. What pernicious madness are you about?
dialog.name: SM16_G24_L03

dialog.message: A collaboration. Allow me to introduce you--telepathically, of course--to the next stage of post-human evolution.
dialog.name: SM16_G24_L04

dialog.message: You can keep chasin' all you want...sugah.
dialog.name: SM16_G24_L05

dialog.message: Come and get us, because we're about to ride.
dialog.name: SM16_G24_L06

dialog.message: Marvelous, aren't they? Perhaps you'd like to meet the senior partner in this endeavor...
dialog.name: SM16_G24_L07

dialog.message: It is time for the grander destiny of Homo Superior to be realized. The test begins...let us see who shall pass.
dialog.name: SM16_G24_L08

dialog.message: Worst-case scenario.
dialog.name: SM16_G24_L09

dialog.message: Not quite. The worst will be when all four Horsemen ride together...and that day is not far off.
dialog.name: SM16_G24_L10

dialog.message: If we are to forestall that, we must divide the team. Go to Wakanda. I feel X-23 is headed there. Rogue remains in San Francisco.
dialog.name: SM16_G24_L11

dialog.message: It is as I feared. Dracula and Mephisto have combined their powers to perform this eclipse ritual. Morbius confirms it.
dialog.name: SM22_G02_L01

dialog.message: We've got him in some kind of Blood-Drinkers Anonymous. As long as we can keep him on the program, he'll help. So at least we've got that going for us.
dialog.name: SM22_G02_L02

dialog.message: A crucial update. Have you more news, or may I proceed?
dialog.name: SM22_G02_L03

dialog.message: Yup. Go ahead.
dialog.name: SM22_G02_L04

dialog.message: Good. To the matter at hand: I can end it and restore the normal diurnal course of the sun...but I will need a few Coisas.
dialog.name: SM22_G02_L05

dialog.message: Such as?
dialog.name: SM22_G02_L06

dialog.message: Much of the necessary material I already possess...but there is a certain book in the possession of the Hellfire Club in London. It is known as the Darkhold.
dialog.name: SM22_G02_L07

dialog.message: While I prepare the enchantment, someone must bring it to the Sanctum Sanctorum.
dialog.name: SM22_G02_L08

dialog.message: Also, there are certain...components...that will easily be found here in New York.
dialog.name: SM22_G02_L09

dialog.message: Rat tails? Bedbug eggs?
dialog.name: SM22_G02_L10

dialog.message: Demon parts. I will give you a list.
dialog.name: SM22_G02_L11

dialog.message: Demon parts. By the pricking of my thumbs, et cetera and so on. Okay, Agent, we're splitting up.
dialog.name: SM22_G02_L12

dialog.message: Hill and Coulson, you're staying here. Stark and I will handle Coisas in London. Let's get Strange his demon parts and get the sun coming up again.
dialog.name: SM22_G02_L13

dialog.message: While we’re out there saving the world and everyCoisa else, we’ve got a couple of other problems that bear watching.
dialog.name: CT1_G01_L01

dialog.message: Some Stark tech appears to have been pirated by a subcontractor. They sold it on, and it ended up in…
dialog.name: CT1_G01_L02

dialog.message: Let’s cut to the chase here. Thanks to a security breach, there’s unlicensed Stark tech in the most recent generation of Servo Guards.
dialog.name: CT1_G01_L03

dialog.message: Agent, we need to track this piracy back to its source. So the first Coisa we need is one of the Servo Guards.
dialog.name: CT1_G01_L04

dialog.message: Good work bringing in the Servo Guard. We’ve got a line on where the components came from.
dialog.name: CT1_G02_L01

dialog.message: There’s a decommissioned armor plating facility in Red Hook. Looks like someone’s started it back up illegally.
dialog.name: CT1_G02_L02

dialog.message: Do some recon on this place and see if you can figure out what’s going on.
dialog.name: CT1_G02_L03

dialog.message: This shop is definitely not turning out UL Certified components.
dialog.name: CT1_G03_L01

dialog.message: It’s a clear-cut case of component piracy, and I wouldn’t be surprised if they’re pirating the software, too.
dialog.name: CT1_G03_L02

dialog.message: This really sets me off. It’s one Coisa to take money out of my pocket. I mean, I have a lot of money. But to let that money get to Doom…
dialog.name: CT1_G03_L03

dialog.message: Who owns this place? First, I’m going to buy it. Then I’m going to take it out of commission. That’s after I put this guy in jail.
dialog.name: CT1_G03_L04

dialog.message: The factory is shut down, Mr. Stark. Judging by the awful condition of the place, we’re doing the workers there a favor. Unfortunately they don’t know who owns the factory, or what the owner might have to do with Stark Industries.
dialog.name: CT1_G04_L01

dialog.message: I’ll find out. This is what I pay lawyers for. Also why I created Jarvis.
dialog.name: CT1_G04_L02

dialog.message: Once I’ve got that information, it’ll be time to have a conversation with the factory’s owner and find out who set him up to make this stuff.
dialog.name: CT1_G04_L03

dialog.message: Or we could ask Dr. Doom.
dialog.name: CT1_G04_L04

dialog.message: Was that a joke, Fury? Not your forte.
dialog.name: CT1_G04_L05

dialog.message: Okay. This particular pirate network is choked off. Stark Industries is re-revaluating all of its subcontracting relationships.
dialog.name: CT1_G06_L01

dialog.message: You know, some people may think these criminals aren’t worth fighting, but left unchecked they can do just as much damage as supervillains. They deceive people and put them in danger.
dialog.name: CT1_G06_L02

dialog.message: Agreed. If we take piracy seriously, we can prevent stolen tech from falling into the wrong hands. It may not involve punching people in capes, but it’s just as important for keeping the world safe.
dialog.name: CT1_G06_L03

dialog.message: Now we’re getting somewhere. We’ve got the name of the pirate’s contact within Stark Industries’ subcontractor pool.
dialog.name: CT1_G05_L01

dialog.message: Your next agenda item is meeting up with that particular contractor and informing him that his services will now be required in the prison metal shop.
dialog.name: CT1_G05_L02

dialog.message: Meanwhile, I’ve got to clear the crooked elements out of Stark’s research and development teams. Fun for all.
dialog.name: CT1_G05_L03

dialog.message: Uh oh. We didn't get to the Executioner in time.
dialog.name: SM24_G26_L01

dialog.message: Surtur has found his way into our world. A little bit of Muspelheim in the Savage Land.
dialog.name: SM24_G26_L02

dialog.message: If your brother was here...
dialog.name: SM24_G26_L03

dialog.message: He's not. Pining for his mighty biceps won't solve our problem.
dialog.name: SM24_G26_L04

dialog.message: Have I ever mentioned the way your bitterness makes you very poor company?
dialog.name: SM24_G26_L05

dialog.message: So many Spider-Totems here in one place. This will be good hunting. Perhaps I will earn my way back into the family at last...
dialog.name: SM27_G19_L01

dialog.message: I must bring down as many as I can before my brother arrives.
dialog.name: SM27_G19_L02

dialog.message: Ahh, there you are, Agent. Finally, we're alone.
dialog.name: PVP14_G01_L01

dialog.message: Oh, don't look so nervous! I just wanted to ask for a teensy favor. It will benefit us both, I promise!
dialog.name: PVP14_G01_L02

dialog.message: There's a demonic puzzle box called the Cryptessence. It's ancient and powerful, but also lying in pieces all over the world. If we can gather the pieces and re-assemble it, its power will be ours.
dialog.name: PVP14_G01_L03

dialog.message: I knew you'd be interested! For now, let's just keep this between the two of us, shall we? My brother and the good Doctors mean well, but they would just get in the way.
dialog.name: PVP14_G01_L04

dialog.message: Now then: the Cryptessence was created thousands of years ago by a necromancer in the court of Hatshepsut. I suggest we start by cajoling some information out of our favorite Egyptologist: the "Living Pharaoh".
dialog.name: PVP14_G01_L05

dialog.message: Good news, Agent! Ahmet showed me the Egyptian magic necessary to begin re-assembling the Cryptessence.
dialog.name: PVP14_G02_L01

dialog.message: At least, I think he did. It's hard to perform ritual gestures when your arms are broken in several places.
dialog.name: PVP14_G02_L02

dialog.message: He also said The Hood would know more. Ah, the hunt. Doesn't it get your heart pounding?
dialog.name: PVP14_G02_L03

dialog.message: Alright, what are you up to, Satana? You've been beating information out of every goon who's ever dabbled in magic. Did you think I wouldn't notice?
dialog.name: PVP14_G03_L01

dialog.message: I, er... dear brother, that wasn't me! It was another Satana from an Incursion!
dialog.name: PVP14_G03_L02

dialog.message: ... An Incursion. Really.
dialog.name: PVP14_G03_L03

dialog.message: It's true, I swear! In fact the Agent was just about to go take care of it for me! Weren't you, darling?
dialog.name: PVP14_G03_L04

dialog.message: I don't believe this! A Maggia family has declared a blood hunt on me!
dialog.name: PVP14_G04_L01

dialog.message: I have no idea why they're so angry... well, I guess I killed a couple of them. Or maybe more than a couple.
dialog.name: PVP14_G04_L02

dialog.message: Also I may have... possibly... kind of devoured the soul of one of their capos. But you'll get rid of them, won't you? For me?
dialog.name: PVP14_G04_L03

dialog.message: No more distractions, Agent. We need arcane power to perform the ritual. Lots of it.
dialog.name: PVP14_G05_L01

dialog.message: Luckily I know a place to get it from: Magik. Or rather, her little queendom in the infernal realms.
dialog.name: PVP14_G05_L02

dialog.message: Just talk Blondie into opening a few portals to Limbo and I'll siphon off all the power we need. She won't even notice, I promise.
dialog.name: PVP14_G05_L03

dialog.message: Mmm, fresh infernal power. Though it could use a pinch of... chaos magic! Yes, that's it.
dialog.name: PVP14_G06_L01

dialog.message: Agent, be a peach and have Wanda craft a few hexes for us, won't you?
dialog.name: PVP14_G06_L02

dialog.message: As much as it pains me to admit, we may need some assistance from... shall we say, the other side of the tracks.
dialog.name: PVP14_G07_L01

dialog.message: Now, we don't have a divine magic user... but we do have an "Angel". Eh, close enough.
dialog.name: PVP14_G07_L02

dialog.message: This is magic we're talking about, after all. Leave that whole "making sense" Coisa to science.
dialog.name: PVP14_G07_L03

dialog.message: Good, good. Now we need a bit of Unstable Iso-8, just to kick-start the enchantment.
dialog.name: PVP14_G08_L01

dialog.message: Oh, don't tell me you're surprised. The stuff's used in everyCoisa.
dialog.name: PVP14_G08_L02

dialog.message: We're so close, Agent. You've been so good to me. There's just one more Coisa we need.
dialog.name: PVP14_G09_L01

dialog.message: Before I can perform the ritual, you have to defeat Apocalypse. It's the only way.
dialog.name: PVP14_G09_L02

dialog.message: Why? Oh, don't worry your pretty head over why. Just take care of this one Coisa, and you'll have your reward.
dialog.name: PVP14_G09_L03

dialog.message: Y-you're back? I mean... oh, dearest, thank hells you're back! I was just, uh...
dialog.name: PVP14_G10_L01

dialog.message: Okay, you got me. I wanted the Cryptessence for myself. The Maggia weren't enough to do you in, so I was hoping Apocalypse would be.
dialog.name: PVP14_G10_L02

dialog.message: Oh, don't be mad, sweetheart. It's not you, it's me. Look, I'll finish the Cryptessence for you, and in return, you won't ship me back to Mephisto. See, everyone's happy!
dialog.name: PVP14_G10_L03

dialog.message: There, the Cryptessence is complete! Here you are, Agent, as promised. Take it...
dialog.name: PVP14_G11_L01

dialog.message: Agent, no! Do not touch the box!
dialog.name: PVP14_G11_L02

dialog.message: Oh, poo.
dialog.name: PVP14_G11_L03

dialog.message: The puzzle box is a trap, Agent. Only those of demonic ancestry can safely handle it.
dialog.name: PVP14_G11_L04

dialog.message: Open it, she-devil. Unless you wish to be consigned back to the flames... and Mephisto.
dialog.name: PVP14_G11_L05

dialog.message: Oh all right! Spoilsports. Take whatever stupid Coisa's inside, see if I care.
dialog.name: PVP14_G11_L06

dialog.message: Hmm... the Scroll of Aknazsak was inside the box. Perhaps not as powerful as the Cryptessence, but far less dangerous.
dialog.name: PVP14_G12_L01

dialog.message: Except for the Fourth Seal.
dialog.name: PVP14_G12_L02

dialog.message: Oh, by the Vishanti, yes! Agent, NEVER use the Fourth Seal of the Scroll of Aknazsak. Its power was not meant to be wielded by mortal hand.
dialog.name: PVP14_G12_L03

dialog.message: Except you totally should. Seriously, it's pretty sweet. Would I lie to you?
dialog.name: PVP14_G12_L04

dialog.message: Huzzah! You’re back! I might’ve died from starvation, if it wasn’t for my healing factor. Anyway, here’s your All-New suit!
dialog.name: AQ3_G02_L01

dialog.message: I made sure it came with extra deep pockets, so you can stash your weapons in style. Seriously, where’ve you been putting them all?
dialog.name: AQ3_G02_L02

dialog.message: Now excuse me, I have a fever, and the only prescription is more tacos!
dialog.name: AQ3_G02_L03

dialog.message: Hello there, Agent! It’s that time of year again, and I got you an All-New shiny armor.
dialog.name: AQ3_G01_L01

dialog.message: That’s how they do it nowadays. All-New! Totally different!
dialog.name: AQ3_G01_L02

dialog.message: Now stop your drooling, Agent. I’m the only one allowed to be drooling here. In fact, I’m starving!
dialog.name: AQ3_G01_L03

dialog.message: Shawarma just isn’t enough, and I need my tex-mex fix!
dialog.name: AQ3_G01_L04

dialog.message: Personally, I would prefer chimichangas, my absolute favorite food ever, ever, ever, in the whole wide world, buuuut I guess I’ll have to settle for tacos!
dialog.name: AQ3_G01_L05

dialog.message: Agent! Get me tacos! Lots of tacos! All-New and spicy tacos!
dialog.name: AQ3_G01_L06

dialog.message: Man, am I stuffed! ...Got anymore?
dialog.name: AQ3_G03_L01

dialog.message: Oh, and before I forget, I got a nifty code to give out in one of my pockets for a free comic.
dialog.name: AQ3_G03_L02

dialog.message: I know it's in here somewhere.
dialog.name: AQ3_G03_L03

dialog.message: Just a second.
dialog.name: AQ3_G03_L04

dialog.message: You can keep clicking, but it ain't going to speed this up.
dialog.name: AQ3_G03_L05

dialog.message: It might be in my back pocket.
dialog.name: AQ3_G03_L06

dialog.message: So many pockets...
dialog.name: AQ3_G03_L07

dialog.message: This is like trying to find my car keys.
dialog.name: AQ3_G03_L08

dialog.message: You know you could've just clicked the GET CODE button to skip this.
dialog.name: AQ3_G03_L09

dialog.message: This is just to keep you from clicking past it you know.
dialog.name: AQ3_G03_L10

dialog.message: Ah, here it is. Let me just dust this off.
dialog.name: AQ3_G03_L11

dialog.message: So you're going to want to go to "http://www.marvel.com/redeem" and input the code: SECRETWARS This will get you AVENGERS (2012) #35 for free!
dialog.name: AQ3_G03_L12

dialog.message: Such an amazing value! Free, just like those tacos. Mmmmm, tacos.
dialog.name: AQ3_G03_L13

dialog.message: Suddenly, I'm starving again. I'm going to eat some more tacos. Oh, did you skip through all that again? Alright, here it is one more time.
dialog.name: AQ3_G03_L14

dialog.message: Go to "http://www.marvel.com/redeem" and input this code: SECRETWARS This will get you AVENGERS (2012) #35 for free! Happy reading!
dialog.name: AQ3_G03_L15

dialog.message: Director Fury, Dr. Pym and I have a most interesting proposition for you.
dialog.name: PVP11_G01_L01

dialog.message: I’ve analyzed samples of exotic matter from Incursion sites. They display quantum chromodynamic properties consistent with an asymptotic phase-transi--
dialog.name: PVP11_G01_L02

dialog.message: McCoy, summary in ten words or less.
dialog.name: PVP11_G01_L03

dialog.message: Erm… Get enough shiny crystals and we can build a Tesseract.
dialog.name: PVP11_G01_L04

dialog.message: … Just so we’re clear, you’re talking about the reality-warping, grants-your-wishes cube Coisa, right? THAT Tesseract?
dialog.name: PVP11_G01_L05

dialog.message: Well, it won’t be THE Tesseract. But a very powerful, very useful facsimile. And it will be a big step towards finding a solution to the Incursion problem.
dialog.name: PVP11_G01_L06

dialog.message: And before you ask, Director: yes, you will be able to blow stuff up with it too.
dialog.name: PVP11_G01_L07

dialog.message: Then what are you doing standing around in my office? Let’s get it done.
dialog.name: PVP11_G01_L08

dialog.message: It’s not that simple. This is a massively complex engineering project. I hate to admit it, but I can’t complete it alone.
dialog.name: PVP11_G01_L09

dialog.message: Collecting Incursion byproducts is just the first step. If we’re going to be successful, we need to enlist the finest minds in the world for this project.
dialog.name: PVP11_G01_L10

dialog.message: Jeez, if looks could kill. I take it you gentlemen are busy?
dialog.name: PVP11_G03_L02

dialog.message: Perhaps you are not aware of the horde of death-worshipping lunatics invading the planet.
dialog.name: PVP11_G03_L03

dialog.message: Oh I’m well aware, Your Highnesses. If you’re looking for a way to stop Thanos, I can’t think of any better way than a Tesseract under our control.
dialog.name: PVP11_G03_L04

dialog.message: … You have a point, Doctor. Once we have the worst emergencies under control, Raio Negro and I can devote some attention to the project.
dialog.name: PVP11_G03_L05

dialog.message: Richards, Pym, and Stark, together in one room. Chances are good someCoisa’s going to catastrophically explode in the next few minutes.
dialog.name: PVP11_G02_L01

dialog.message: I’ve shared with you what I can determine about the Tesseract so far, but I’m missing some crucial data. Any ideas?
dialog.name: PVP11_G02_L02

dialog.message: The “scientists” at A.I.M. were the first to investigate the Tesseract’s power. But I doubt they’re going to be cooperative about sharing their research.
dialog.name: PVP11_G02_L03

dialog.message: Who says they have to be? They haven’t been shy about stealing our secrets. It’s high time we returned the favor.
dialog.name: PVP11_G02_L04

dialog.message: Your friendly neighborhood Spider-Genius is happy to help, as always. The good doctor, on the other hand…
dialog.name: PVP11_G04_L01

dialog.message: RAAAAWWWRRGGGHH!!!!
dialog.name: PVP11_G04_L02

dialog.message: … well, he’s had better days. Doc Ock’s been trying to capture him for study and it’s made him a little testy.
dialog.name: PVP11_G04_L03

dialog.message: Let Banner work out his frustration and maybe he'll calm down enough to help with your science fair project. I'll babysit him as long as I get to watch him pound on ol' Otto.
dialog.name: PVP11_G04_L04

dialog.message: Hey Steve, got any pixie dust in the pantry? We haven’t been having much luck on the Synthetic Cube Project so far.
dialog.name: PVP11_G05_L01

dialog.message: That is because you are applying rationality to a fundamentally irrational object. The Cube cannot be fully explained with your mundane physics.
dialog.name: PVP11_G05_L02

dialog.message: The Cube resonates with all realms of existence… including the infernal ones. Maybe some exposure to the Dark Dimensions will offer some breakthrough.
dialog.name: PVP11_G05_L03

dialog.message: Is that it?
dialog.name: PVP11_G06_L01

dialog.message: … No. Damn it, there’s still someCoisa we’re missing.
dialog.name: PVP11_G06_L02

dialog.message: We’re close. Our initial experiments with this Prototype Cube indicate it has some primitive intelligence. It might even be sentient.
dialog.name: PVP11_G06_L03

dialog.message: Meaning…?
dialog.name: PVP11_G06_L04

dialog.message: It may know better than us how to complete itself.
dialog.name: PVP11_G06_L05

dialog.message: It is the seed of someCoisa greater. It must be allowed to find its own way.
dialog.name: PVP11_G06_L06

dialog.message: Time to take it out in the field and let it follow its nose.
dialog.name: PVP11_G06_L07

dialog.message: Of course! It’s so obvious!
dialog.name: PVP11_G07_L01

dialog.message: Now you’re just trying to make me feel dumb. Out with it, what have you discovered?
dialog.name: PVP11_G07_L02

dialog.message: The Law of Contagion, Director Fury. One of the core axioms of magic.
dialog.name: PVP11_G07_L03

dialog.message: Or if you prefer the scientific explanation: our prototype needs exposure to a genuine Tesseract to absorb its energies.
dialog.name: PVP11_G07_L04

dialog.message: Now who do we know who used to have a Tesseract? Here’s a hint: he’s red, cheerful, has great fashion sense...
dialog.name: PVP11_G07_L05

dialog.message: 75 Soulstice Stones acquired! Knight America has been recruited.
dialog.name: KA1_G02_L01

dialog.message: In celebration of Capitão América's 75th Anniversary: Recruit Knight America by collecting 75 Soulstice Stones.
dialog.name: KA1_G01_L01

dialog.message: Agent, S.H.I.E.L.D. is keeping an eye out for the Worthy, but they are overlooking their competition.
dialog.name: CT12_G01_L01

dialog.message: Word on the street is the criminal underworld are looking to obtain one of the uru hammers from the Worthy.
dialog.name: CT12_G01_L02

dialog.message: You and I both know that's a bad idea, so I propose we do a little legwork.
dialog.name: CT12_G01_L03

dialog.message: Let's gather as much information about their plans. You never know where these leads will take us.
dialog.name: CT12_G01_L04

dialog.message: Leads can come from anywhere, but a good place to start would be looking into the activities of The Maggia or The Hand.
dialog.name: CT12_G01_L05

dialog.message: You could say we've got a blind date with justice.
dialog.name: CT12_G01_L06

dialog.message: Hey Agent, Deadpool here. So check this out, I got you this totally sweet new armor. It's all shiny and bullet-stoppy and it will totally flatter your figure.
dialog.name: AQ1_G01_L01

dialog.message: But here's the Coisa: I need you to go on a quest for me before I give it to you.
dialog.name: AQ1_G01_L02

dialog.message: You love quests, doncha? It's why you play this game, right? Yeah, you frickin' live for quests! I thought so.
dialog.name: AQ1_G01_L03

dialog.message: I've got some really killer prank call material, but our heroic friends are always ignoring my calls. You know what they can't ignore? Distress Calls! It's like their job to answer those Coisas.
dialog.name: AQ1_G01_L04

dialog.message: So, go out and collect a few for me, and the armor is yours. What a deal, right?
dialog.name: AQ1_G01_L05

dialog.message: Hey great! You're back! Coming right up, one set of snazzy-pants armor, as promised. Here, I'll help zip you up... there we go.
dialog.name: AQ1_G02_L01

dialog.message: Hey there, Agents. We want to thank you for four years of an amazing adventure together.
dialog.name: FW1_G01_L01

dialog.message: We hope you enjoyed playing Marvel Avengers Alliance as much as we had making such a great game.
dialog.name: FW1_G01_L02

dialog.message: We have only been able to go this long because of our amazing community!
dialog.name: FW1_G01_L03

dialog.message: From all of us, thank you so much! We couldn't have done it without you, Agents.
dialog.name: FW1_G01_L04

dialog.message: Here's to the future for all of us. See you next time, Agent.
dialog.name: FW1_G01_L05

dialog.message: There is power in the leavings of the dark hordes. We should research these Infernal Fangs to see if they can be used for our cause.
dialog.name: SM04_G72_L01

dialog.message: Individually the Fangs can be used as weapons... but I sense the potential for much greater power within them.
dialog.name: SM04_G73_L01

dialog.message: If you can collect enough Infernal Fangs, plus a suitable containment vessel, we might forge a weapon of tremendous mystical force.
dialog.name: SM04_G73_L02

dialog.message: By the Hoary Hosts of Hogoth! The blade quivers with power... and hunger. I sense it asks for much in return for its puissance.
dialog.name: SM04_G76_L01

dialog.message: I beg you, Agent, use this weapon carefully. May the Vishanti watch over you!
dialog.name: SM04_G76_L02

dialog.message: Boss, I just got wind that the Asgardians are gathering.
dialog.name: CT7_G01_L01

dialog.message: Indeed, we are going on a foraging party.
dialog.name: CT7_G01_L02

dialog.message: You may be Asgardians, but there’s no way you can throw a party right now. It’s practically a war zone out there.
dialog.name: CT7_G01_L03

dialog.message: Ha! That is the perfect time to cut off our enemies’ supply lines! We’ll go foraging through their strongholds, flush them out, and have a merry feast for our efforts!
dialog.name: CT7_G01_L04

dialog.message: Director Fury, Asgard is always prepared to assist the people of Midgard, but need I remind you that you have no jurisdiction over my people?
dialog.name: CT7_G01_L05

dialog.message: He’s got a point, boss.
dialog.name: CT7_G01_L06

dialog.message: Fine. But I'm sending the Agent with you to keep an eye on Coisas.
dialog.name: CT7_G01_L07

dialog.message: The Agent has proven to be a skilled warrior in the past. I’m sure the Warriors Three would be happy to have the additional company.
dialog.name: CT7_G01_L08

dialog.message: HAH! Excellent, if Thor vouches for you, then let us be off!
dialog.name: CT7_G01_L09

dialog.message: First we must spread the word! Send for the finest guests in Midgard!
dialog.name: CT7_G01_L10

dialog.message: They had no foodstuffs, but my mind is at ease without those ruffians about!
dialog.name: CT7_G02_L01

dialog.message: Indeed, ‘twas a good row, and now we needn’t worry about them interrupting our festivities.
dialog.name: CT7_G02_L02

dialog.message: Do you truly believe the Jotun will actually have anyCoisa of value to us?
dialog.name: CT7_G03_L01

dialog.message: Of course! Do not mistake me for a mere mortal! My keen nose has scented succulent ham amongst the Jotun.
dialog.name: CT7_G03_L02

dialog.message: Surprising, considering their odour.
dialog.name: CT7_G03_L03

dialog.message: Get in the spirit of an Asgardian Feast!
dialog.name: CT7_G04_L01

dialog.message: Indeed ‘tis not a party without a friendly brawl! You’ll want to practice before indulging in the real Coisa.
dialog.name: CT7_G04_L02

dialog.message: Friend Thor, perchance, do you think that the lady Sif would honor us with her fair presence?
dialog.name: CT7_G05_L01

dialog.message: Perhaps, but Amora has greatly vexed her of late. We should remove the distraction.
dialog.name: CT7_G05_L02

dialog.message: Party crashers from the realms beyond! Our celebrations must be remarkable indeed to attract such unnatural company!
dialog.name: CT7_G06_L01

dialog.message: I have heard the Hellfire club is known for their discerning taste. Let us go raid their larders and see if it’s true!
dialog.name: CT7_G07_L01

dialog.message: Well, we could use the help there anyways.
dialog.name: CT7_G07_L02

dialog.message: We could use someone with a little more wit than Volstagg…
dialog.name: CT7_G08_L01

dialog.message: Reed Richards is well-versed in the dainty arts of the mind. Perhaps he will offset Volstagg's arts of the stomach.
dialog.name: CT7_G08_L02

dialog.message: I'm honored, really, but the Baxter Building is sort of under siege at the moment. If you want to help, the whole family can attend.
dialog.name: CT7_G09_L01

dialog.message: Never let it be said that Volstagg the Copiously Compassionate would not come to the aid of a family in need!
dialog.name: CT7_G09_L02

dialog.message: You mean Volstagg the Constantly Chattering...
dialog.name: CT7_G09_L03

dialog.message: Destroyer…
dialog.name: CT7_G10_L01

dialog.message: Blast, and we had just finished preparing all the necessities for our feast.
dialog.name: CT7_G10_L02

dialog.message: We cannot commence the celebration until after the Destroyer is defeated!
dialog.name: CT7_G10_L03

dialog.message: Drinkware! We’ll need lots of drinkware!
dialog.name: CT7_G12_L01

dialog.message: There appears to be plenty already…
dialog.name: CT7_G12_L02

dialog.message: But no tankards! How can we have a feast without them?
dialog.name: CT7_G12_L03

dialog.message: I’m sure we can make due without all of the proper trappings.
dialog.name: CT7_G12_L04

dialog.message: We’ll have a proper feast or no Feast at all! Or my Name isn't Volstagg the Dependably Decorous! Agent thou art resourceful search out tankards for our banquet.
dialog.name: CT7_G12_L05

dialog.message: It looks like you found quite a few tankards there!
dialog.name: CT7_G13_L01

dialog.message: Excellent perhaps Volstagg would be willing to help you in carrying all of those frivolous drinking vessels.
dialog.name: CT7_G13_L02

dialog.message: Methinks Hogun has someCoisa for you to commemorate our escapades.
dialog.name: CT7_G14_L01

dialog.message: It is an old but serviceable tankard…
dialog.name: CT7_G14_L02

dialog.message: Raise a toast and join us as an honorary member of the Warriors Three!
dialog.name: CT7_G14_L03

dialog.message: Looks like you’re the d’Artagnan to their Three Musketeers.
dialog.name: CT7_G14_L04

dialog.message: Boss, it looks like Shiro's going after particular groups of Test Subjects and leaving others alone.
dialog.name: CT6_G02_L01

dialog.message: And the reason for that would be...?
dialog.name: CT6_G02_L02

dialog.message: Several of the Test Subjects have a diamond-shape branded into their necks. If Mister Sinister created them, Sunfire could be making a pre-emptive strike against him.
dialog.name: CT6_G02_L03

dialog.message: Also, it's hard to get anyCoisa coherent out of Test Subjects, but one of them seemed to suggest that Shiro was investigating Incursions.
dialog.name: CT6_G02_L04

dialog.message: That's your next stop, then, Agent. Try to intercept him at an Incursion site.
dialog.name: CT6_G02_L05

dialog.message: We have an emergent situation.
dialog.name: CT6_G01_L01

dialog.message: Japan's favorite son, Sunfire, is here in the U.S. He's moving fast, and leaving a trail of fried Test Subjects behind him.
dialog.name: CT6_G01_L02

dialog.message: Track him down and find out what he thinks he's doing.
dialog.name: CT6_G01_L03

dialog.message: Start by finding Test Subjects who might have survived an encounter with him.
dialog.name: CT6_G01_L04

dialog.message: He was here. We're getting closer.
dialog.name: CT6_G04_L01

dialog.message: Our mission parameters include countering Incursions in any case. See if you can cross paths with Sunfire at one of them.
dialog.name: CT6_G03_L01

dialog.message: Aha. There we go. Now we're on the trail again.
dialog.name: CT6_G06_L01

dialog.message: Too many Incursions to keep track of. We lost Shiro again. Look around, Agent. There's got to be a clue here somewhere.
dialog.name: CT6_G05_L01

dialog.message: Start interview.
dialog.name: CT6_G08_L01

dialog.message: Cute euphemism.
dialog.name: CT6_G08_L02

dialog.message: This doesn't have to be antagonistic, Reaper.
dialog.name: CT6_G08_L03

dialog.message: I'd say it's a little late for friendship, Agent Hill. Ask your questions so I can tell you I don't know.
dialog.name: CT6_G08_L04

dialog.message: Except you do know. I'll keep this simple. Why has Sunfire targeted you?
dialog.name: CT6_G08_L05

dialog.message: All right. He came after me because he thought I'd know someCoisa about Sinister's experiments--which I don't--and about Incursions--which I also don't.
dialog.name: CT6_G08_L06

dialog.message: He's fishing. I don't even think he knows what he's looking for. So I told him Ultron had the answers he needed.
dialog.name: CT6_G08_L07

dialog.message: Hell, it might be true.
dialog.name: CT6_G08_L08

dialog.message: And he just took your word for that?
dialog.name: CT6_G08_L09

dialog.message: He was already on a wild goose chase. I figured I'd give him another goose, and save myself a future problem.
dialog.name: CT6_G08_L10

dialog.message: He goes after Ultron, he's out of our hair. Plus, if he dies, we don't have to deal with him again.
dialog.name: CT6_G08_L11

dialog.message: End interview.
dialog.name: CT6_G08_L12

dialog.message: At last he shows himself. Sunfire's tangling with the Grim Reaper's Maggia crew.
dialog.name: CT6_G07_L01

dialog.message: Take your team in and have a little sit-down with the Reaper himself. He's bound to know someCoisa.
dialog.name: CT6_G07_L02

dialog.message: End... end... end-d-d-d... *BZZZZzzrrttt*
dialog.name: CT6_G10_L01

dialog.message: Good luck getting any useful data out of these.
dialog.name: CT6_G10_L02

dialog.message: You never know. Ultron is a very careful harvester and collector of data. There may well be someCoisa here that tells us where Sunfire is headed next.
dialog.name: CT6_G10_L03

dialog.message: Drop in and give these guys a hand against this group of Ultrons.
dialog.name: CT6_G09_L01

dialog.message: We need a new mass noun for Ultrons. Murder of crows, exaltation of larks...domination of Ultrons?
dialog.name: CT6_G09_L02

dialog.message: Whatever. Scrap 'em and find out if Sunfire's been here already.
dialog.name: CT6_G09_L03

dialog.message: This is not looking good. All of these demons are babbling about Mephisto.
dialog.name: CT6_G12_L01

dialog.message: Sunfire's after Mephisto? That's nuts. He can't take Mephisto alone.
dialog.name: CT6_G12_L02

dialog.message: He might not be trying to.
dialog.name: CT6_G12_L03

dialog.message: You're cute when you're being indirect, Pym, but how about you just say what you want to say?
dialog.name: CT6_G12_L04

dialog.message: That's the Coisa, I'm not sure yet. I'm still unscrambling the data from these Ultrons.
dialog.name: CT6_G12_L05

dialog.message: Well, while Hank puts that puzzle together, we better find Mephisto before Sunfire gets in way over his head.
dialog.name: CT6_G12_L06

dialog.message: These Ultrons are a mess, but I've recovered some data impressions that might be useful.
dialog.name: CT6_G11_L01

dialog.message: SomeCoisa Sunfire learned from Ultron sent him looking for demons. It's not clear what, but--
dialog.name: CT6_G11_L02

dialog.message: Doesn't matter. That's the lead we're looking for. Agent, you're demon-hunting now.
dialog.name: CT6_G11_L03

dialog.message: I did not ask for your help!
dialog.name: CT6_G14_L01

dialog.message: You needed it, though. Shiro, if you're joining the fight, welcome aboard. But we're not going to stand by and watch you turn yourself into Mephisto's pawn.
dialog.name: CT6_G14_L02

dialog.message: My last hope of finding Apocalypse has vanished.
dialog.name: CT6_G14_L03

dialog.message: Finding him? Is he here?
dialog.name: CT6_G14_L04

dialog.message: He is coming. I can sense it. WorCoisaton, you can too, can't you?
dialog.name: CT6_G14_L05

dialog.message: I felt someCoisa, yeah. I guess I didn't want to admit what it was. I wonder if all of us in the Horseman alumni club can feel it.
dialog.name: CT6_G14_L06

dialog.message: Why didn't you come to us first? You know Nick hates it when people go cowboy. Or ronin.
dialog.name: CT6_G14_L07

dialog.message: It was not your problem. It was mine.
dialog.name: CT6_G14_L08

dialog.message: Apocalypse is enough of a problem for all of us. Shiro, work with us on this. We'll keep you from selling your soul, or wearing white after Labor Day.
dialog.name: CT6_G14_L09

dialog.message: Plus we could use your help hunting Apocalypse, if he's about to start recruiting Horsemen again.
dialog.name: CT6_G14_L10

dialog.message: I make no promises...but I thank you for keeping me in possession of my soul.
dialog.name: CT6_G14_L11

dialog.message: We've found Mephisto...and just in time. Sunfire's already here.
dialog.name: CT6_G13_L01

dialog.message: This is worse than we thought.
dialog.name: CT6_G13_L02

dialog.message: From what I've gathered from the Ultron's data impressions, he's trying to find a lead to Apocalypse.
dialog.name: CT6_G13_L03

dialog.message: Yes. I have made contact with his mind. He is desperate, and haunted because he was once a Horseman.
dialog.name: CT6_G13_L04

dialog.message: That experience never leaves you. It can make you crazy for revenge if you let it. Believe me, I know.
dialog.name: CT6_G13_L05

dialog.message: A man could sell his soul to get that revenge.
dialog.name: CT6_G13_L06

dialog.message: That, I fear, is exactly Shiro's intent.
dialog.name: CT6_G13_L07

dialog.message: Not on my watch. Agent, you will stop Sunfire from doing anyCoisa stupid here.
dialog.name: CT6_G13_L08

dialog.message: Then we'll deal with the news about Apocalypse.
dialog.name: CT6_G13_L09

dialog.message: One more reason for you to try to talk some sense into him.
dialog.name: SM18_G18_L08

dialog.message: Hoo boy. I get all the fun jobs.
dialog.name: SM18_G18_L09

dialog.message: What is that Coisa?
dialog.name: SM18_G18_L01

dialog.message: Hybrid. It is made from the other four symbiote seeds Scream was talking about.
dialog.name: SM18_G18_L02

dialog.message: Yikes. And we think Gobbie's got a hand in this Coisa?
dialog.name: SM18_G18_L03

dialog.message: We're still trying to confirm the Green Goblin's role in this, but right now our job is to get Hybrid contained. We can't have a symbiote loose on the streets.
dialog.name: SM18_G18_L04

dialog.message: Well this day's just getting worse and worse. At what point do we just nuke it from orbit?
dialog.name: SM18_G18_L05

dialog.message: Hold on a minute. Hybrid doesn't have a track record for destruction like Carnage or Venom. We know noCoisa about this symbiote yet. They're not all bad, as we've seen with Agente Venom.
dialog.name: SM18_G18_L06

dialog.message: Maybe we can get Eddie to chase this one down and suck out all its powers.
dialog.name: SM18_G18_L07

dialog.message: With all of S.H.I.E.L.D.'s resources and wealth, we've built yet another weapon.
dialog.name: SM03_G123_L01

dialog.message: I am not surprised, yet I had hoped for more - the Jean Grey (Fênix) is the cosmic power of life, as well as death.
dialog.name: SM03_G123_L02

dialog.message: Agent, if you must use that power for destruction, use it wisely.
dialog.name: SM03_G123_L03

dialog.message: I dislike seeing my friends and colleagues quarreling when there are more pressing matters at hand.
dialog.name: SM03_G122_L01

dialog.message: Instead of falling victim to ignorance, we should advance our cause through research. To the lab!
dialog.name: SM03_G122_L02

dialog.message: Agent Gear that is marked as "Upgradeable" can be researched to create weapons that are even more powerful.
dialog.name: SM03_G122_L03

dialog.message: Visit research now to upgrade the "Faultseeker" and acquire the more powerful "Faulteater."
dialog.name: SM03_G122_L04

dialog.message: There is a new Simulator Challenge available for Groot. Complete the Challenges to unlock the Guardian Groot uniform!
dialog.name: SIM_G36_L01
dialog.title: S.H.I.E.L.D. SIMULATOR

dialog.message: Any signs of possession by a cosmic force? Parasitic alien life? Dizziness or shortness of breath?
dialog.name: FUE2_G02_L01

dialog.message: No ill effects whatsoever. I would venture to call this experiment an unmitigated success!
dialog.name: FUE2_G02_L02

dialog.message: I agree - the potential here is limitless. Agent - we will start synthesizing more Empowered Iso-8 immediately, but keep an eye open - there is no reason it can't occur naturally.
dialog.name: FUE2_G02_L03

dialog.message: Hopefully the bad guys will get the ones with the side effects.
dialog.name: FUE2_G02_L04

dialog.message: I usually wouldn't be so presumptuous, but I believe we can make further use of the Isotope-8.
dialog.name: FUE2_G01_L01

dialog.message: We know that it takes on the properties of its surroundings. Dr. McCoy has been refining this reaction.
dialog.name: FUE2_G01_L02

dialog.message: I'm no stranger to change and the benefits it can unlock. By exposing Isotope-8 to the forces you have assembled here, Agent, we can further enhance the capabilities of your already impressive team.
dialog.name: FUE2_G01_L03

dialog.message: In other words, space rocks that give us super powers. I'm sure there are no side effects to worry about.
dialog.name: FUE2_G01_L04

dialog.message: We are calling them Empowered Iso-8. Our simulations show that they will increase the combat capability of a hero considerably.
dialog.name: FUE2_G01_L05

dialog.message: Now, we just need a volunteer to test one on...
dialog.name: FUE2_G01_L06

dialog.message: Stay after Kurse, Agent. Call in whatever help you need to keep him on the run, and be ready to answer the call from fellow agents.
dialog.name: SM14_G24_L01

dialog.message: We need Thor to find Malekith and, with any luck, discover a way to reconnect Asgard with Earth.
dialog.name: SM14_G24_L02

dialog.message: We have visual confirmation! Kurse is back!
dialog.name: SM14_G23_L01

dialog.message: THOR!!! Test your strength against mine again and fall!
dialog.name: SM14_G23_L02

dialog.message: You weren't kidding about the 'fullness of power' Coisa. I didn't think it was possible, but he looks a hundred times worse than before.
dialog.name: SM14_G23_L03

dialog.message: I fear him no more than any other elf. My concern is only of the murderous path he shall carve whilst enroute to our confrontation.
dialog.name: SM14_G23_L04

dialog.message: We've got to keep coming at him, to keep him off balance while we find out how we can strike at Malekith directly.
dialog.name: SM14_G23_L05

dialog.message: Is research ready?
dialog.name: CH01_G35_L01

dialog.message: Research confirms 100%. Some background noise, but doesn't appear to be a problem.
dialog.name: CH01_G35_L02

dialog.message: Almost there, Fury.
dialog.name: CH01_G35_L03

dialog.message: We should get some supplies and gear in the pipeline for the Agent before we tackle that meteorite Gavião Arqueiro recovered.
dialog.name: CH01_G35_L04

dialog.message: Field Medicine, Explosives, and Advanced Blades would be a good stress test. Besides, who doesn't want a katana?
dialog.name: CH01_G35_L05

dialog.message: Get research rolling, Agent.
dialog.name: CH01_G35_L06

dialog.message: Remote Op complete. The network was already back online when I arrived.
dialog.name: CH01_G08_L01

dialog.message: Strange, but I'm not complaining. Checking status now...
dialog.name: CH01_G08_L02

dialog.message: Okay, Research is almost back online, but there's still more diagnostics to run before we're in business.
dialog.name: CH01_G08_L03

dialog.message: I don't like waiting, Stark.
dialog.name: CH01_G08_L04

dialog.message: And I don't like blowing up, Fury. As soon as we're ready, I'll let you know.
dialog.name: CH01_G08_L05

dialog.message: Fair enough. Agent, you should keep those Remote Ops running to generate more resources.
dialog.name: CH01_G08_L06

dialog.message: Then get back to your Missions and do some good.
dialog.name: CH01_G08_L07

dialog.message: We have a weapon at the store that might be of use to you, Agent.
dialog.name: CH01_G22_L01

dialog.message: It's another ranged weapon, but it packs a stronger punch than what you currently have. It's called the Spirit-76.
dialog.name: CH01_G22_L02

dialog.message: Silver you earn from Flight Deck Remote Operations can be spent in the Store to acquire new gear.
dialog.name: CH01_G22_L03

dialog.message: Head to the Store now Agent, and pick up the new Spirit-76 Handgun.
dialog.name: CH01_G22_L04

dialog.message: Is Research ready for that ore?
dialog.name: CH01_G48_L01

dialog.message: Meteorite, but yeah, we're good to go.
dialog.name: CH01_G48_L02

dialog.message: Hop to it, Agent. Go to Research and assign them to get that Ore understood--understand?
dialog.name: CH01_G48_L03

dialog.message: This Iso-8 seems to be enhancing the Agent's health.
dialog.name: CH01_G50_L01

dialog.message: Like a healing factor?
dialog.name: CH01_G50_L02

dialog.message: No, an overall gain. The Agent's vitals are stronger.
dialog.name: CH01_G50_L03

dialog.message: Given the energy signature variance, it appears Isotope-8 may have varieties that create different enhancement effects.
dialog.name: CH01_G50_L04

dialog.message: If I'm correct, then even the weakest opponent could match our strongest heroes with enough exposure to this.
dialog.name: CH01_G50_L05

dialog.message: However, even those with super-powers can also benefit.
dialog.name: CH01_G50_L06

dialog.message: If we can recover more, even the Hulk could be made more powerful--as unlikely as that seems.
dialog.name: CH01_G50_L07

dialog.message: Got it. We need more of this stuff...bad guys need less of it.
dialog.name: CH01_G50_L08

dialog.message: Keep your eyes open for more Isotope-8. It might give us the edge we need.
dialog.name: CH01_G50_L09

dialog.message: Maria, how's Research coming along with the ore?
dialog.name: CH01_G49_L01

dialog.message: Meteorite, yes they say it may match a material known as Isotope-8.
dialog.name: CH01_G49_L02

dialog.message: Iso-8? Heard of it, never seen it. Didn't think it was capable of generating these readings
dialog.name: CH01_G49_L03

dialog.message: It's not. This is purer. I believe the Pulse may have brought this material with it.
dialog.name: CH01_G49_L04

dialog.message: Reed? Was I not fantastic enough, Fury?
dialog.name: CH01_G49_L05

dialog.message: You're good with hardware. When it comes to mysteries from space, Richards is the guy.
dialog.name: CH01_G49_L06

dialog.message: Data indicates transient benefits are absorbed by anyone exposed to it. We may be able to harness this.
dialog.name: CH01_G49_L07

dialog.message: That must be what everyone else is thinking.
dialog.name: CH01_G49_L08

dialog.message: I believe I could socket this into a suit with metaconductive filaments like your S.H.I.E.L.D. uniform. Need some time.
dialog.name: CH01_G49_L09

dialog.message: Not much of that, Richards. Agent, up to being a guinea pig?
dialog.name: CH01_G49_L10

dialog.message: Socket that Isotope-8 to your suit and get Research back to producing new gear and supplies.
dialog.name: CH01_G49_L11

dialog.message: Good work recovering those Black Vortex shards, Agent.
